thread.title: Haunt vs MG
thread.title_full: Haunt vs MG - World of Warcraft Forums

posts.author: Repus
posts.text:
Haunt is great while leveling because it's a powerful nuke that resets when the target dies. Which in all content pre-100 is the instant you cast Haunt.
But multi-dotting is probably just better even still.
I find Haunt to be fun, I often use it in low M+ where pushing out maximum damage doesn't matter, but unless you're going out of your way to abuse the reset mechanic you aren't pulling out magically greater numbers because it has lower uptime than MG and gives less of a damage multiplier as well. You don't have to be able to math to see Haunt is only 15% extra damage for 10 seconds every 25, whereas MG is 25% extra damage for your dots and unless it's high movement is going to be up for a lot more than 10 out of every 25 seconds.
I want Haunt to be good, but it isn't.

thread.title: Haunt vs MG
thread.title_full: Haunt vs MG - World of Warcraft Forums

posts.author: Kigs
posts.text:
12/06/2017 02:45 PM Posted by Repus I want Haunt to be good, but it isn't.
I want the old Haunt back, and baseline too.

thread.title: Haunt vs MG
thread.title_full: Haunt vs MG - World of Warcraft Forums

posts.author: Repus
posts.text:
12/06/2017 06:28 PM Posted by Delofasht 12/06/2017 02:45 PM Posted by Repus
You don't have to be able to math to see Haunt is only 15% extra damage for 10 seconds every 25, whereas MG is 25% extra damage for your dots and unless it's high movement is going to be up for a lot more than 10 out of every 25 seconds.
You do have to be good enough at math to realize that Haunt affects all of your other damage sources besides itself, where MG only affects the dots. Things are not quite as simple as this multiplied by that. . . one has to start figuring out uptime of the debuffs, the percentage of extra damage that is added by simply casting haunts themselves, cast sequence priority, and more. Sorry, but while we think Malefic Grasp is significantly better, the truth is it ends up being only marginally better at best.
Best case scenario is Haunt has a 40% uptime in a minute. Would you rather have 40% uptime on a 15% damage buff, or MG's 25% dot damage buff? Even factoring in that Haunt has a front loaded nuke (500% of spell damage) and the % modifier also affects Drain Soul, it's still not worth it.
Like I said, I take the talent and play with it in lower content, but it doesn't have a niche compared to the other two talents (or maybe it'd best be said that it's niche, which is priority damage on short lived adds, isn't really all that great or suited to Affliction to begin with).

posts.title: Sino Agro Food, Inc. Updates Tri-way Operations | 4-Traders
posts.text:
Guangzhou, China, Dec. 07, 2017 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- GUANGZHOU, China-- Sino Agro Food, Inc. (OTCQX: SIAF | OSE: SIAF-ME), also referred to as “SIAF” or the “Company,” is an agricultural technology corporation focused on protein food including seafood and cattle. The Company produces, distributes, markets, and sells sustainable seafood and beef to meet growing demand for safe, quality food in China. The Company has posted an open memo to its shareholders and other interested parties to provide a comprehensive update on the operations of its investee, Tri-way Industries, Ltd. The document may be viewed or downloaded here: http://www.sinoagrofood.com/sites/default/files/Tri-way_Status_Nov-2017.pdf 

CEO Commentary

Mr. Solomon Lee, CEO of Sino Agro Food, commented, “Our investors have expressed a desire for more detailed information of our operations and concepts behind plans for Tri-way Industries. Please take the time to read the lengthy memo, as we believe it provides an informative appraisal of recent operations, technical considerations, and seafood markets in China. We believe all of these to be positive. Even though occasional modifications to plans may be required, many present marginal opportunities.

The memo indicates history-based production extrapolation for several species, based upon SIAF’s proofs of concept and continual refinements at its first three aquafarms, dating from 2011, and at the Zhongshan aquafarm 4 facility in the last year plus. Tri-way’s historical financial profitability is a matter of record, reported quarterly. We remain highly confident that Tri-way is well positioned to increase both production numbers and gross margins, the pace of which would be accelerated if and when expected development capital additional to cash flow materializes.”

About Sino Agro Food, Inc.

SIAF is an agricultural technology company focused on protein food. The Company produces, distributes, markets, and sells sustainable seafood and beef to the rapidly growing middle class in China. Activities also include production of organic fertilizer and produce. SIAF is a global leader in developing land based recirculating aquaculture systems (“RAS”), and with its partners is the world's largest producer of sustainable RAS prawns. Founded in 2006 and headquartered in Guangzhou, the Company had over 550 employees and revenue of USD 343 million in 2016. Operations are located in Guangdong, Qinghai, and Hunan provinces, and in Shanghai. Sino Agro Food is a public company listed on OTCQX U.S. Premier in the United States and on the Oslo Børs’ Merkur Market in Norway. News and updates about Sino Agro Food, Inc., including key information, are published on the Company’s website ( http://www.sinoagrofood.com ), the Company’s Facebook page ( https://www.facebook.com/SinoAgroFoodInc ), and on twitter @SinoAgroFood.

Forward Looking Statements

All statements other than historical facts are forward-looking statements, which can be identified by the use of forward-looking terminology such as “believes,” “expects” or similar expressions. On multitarget and/or high movement fights you would take WiA. Pretty sure we've had this discussion before on another thread, and whenever anyone tried to site sims to show how bad haunt was, you Judy kept saying that sims were all !@#$ and we were bad for using them. Do new a favor and log your next raid run through tos, iirc I was about your ilvl for most of my parses. Put your feelycrafting to the test.

thread.title: Haunt vs MG
thread.title_full: Haunt vs MG - World of Warcraft Forums

posts.author: Middboss
posts.text:
12/06/2017 07:09 PM Posted by Delofasht 12/06/2017 06:53 PM Posted by Repus
Best case scenario is Haunt has a 40% uptime in a minute. Would you rather have 40% uptime on a 15% damage buff, or MG's 25% dot damage buff? Even factoring in that Haunt has a front loaded nuke (500% of spell damage) and the % modifier also affects Drain Soul, it's still not worth it.
Haunt has less variance and is more forgiving of mistakes. I will risk a 2% difference in performance to play something that feels more versatile to me. I like that I can adapt to hectic add high movement boss fights, council fights, and still do decent enough single target dps. Glad to see you are quite happy with MG though, good for you, enjoy it!
For me, versatile talent > niche.
Haunt is FAR less versatile and extremely punishing if you make a mistake. Adds have to live 10-15 seconds. Any less or more than that, and haunt's effectiveness rapidly diminishes. Also requires adds to spawn very frequently.
There is only one fight in legion where haunt MIGHT be considered viable, and that is ellisandre. That fight is the perfect haunt fight, but even with perfect conditions is still inferior to MG. I am one of the few warlocks likely in the entire world that has used haunt on occassion in a serious raiding guild. It sucks, period.
MG, on the other hand, is a useful tool in nearly all situations. It does not matter when adds spawn, or how long they live, or even if there are any adds to begin with. Its only competition is with writhe on heavy cleave fights.
If you enjoy haunt and want to play haunt, then by all means. I like haunt too. I enjoy it a lot more than the eyesore than is MG.

posts.author: bounceback
posts.text:
I wouldn't break her confidence. I totally agree that no-one should be going home crying every night, but as some of the SLT are friends with the bullying TA it is likely to make little difference if you report it. They will probably just say she is being over sensitive. I speak from experience as I once had some colleagues in a clique who would make snide comments to me. I did tell the HT but as she was particularly friendly with one of them she just told me they were 'throw away comments' and 'not to be so sensitive'. (Eventually a new head came and shook them up so much that they had other things to occupy them LOL!)
Now that your colleague has confided in you she has someone to talk to which will help. It may be that eventually you can persuade her to report it - maybe once she has secured a new job.
Some people are just plain nasty. They must have very miserable home lives to behave this way.
